![zrzut ekranu 2016-11-15 o 12 31 47](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10253750/20304317/c30ae2c8-ab2f-11e6-8ae6-cfc3c28fa738.png)

data.title: Add editor action copySelection[Up/Down]
Provide a meaningful binary-file preview and "diff"
data.body:
Clicking on a binary file in the explorer should provide something better than an error page.

A 'pretty-print' preview of the selected file should appear, including:

- file creation / modifcation / access times, file size
- Any metadata attached
- An image preview and dimensions for image files
- An icon for executable files (perhaps even showing the different icon sizes embedded), as well as the exe-specific metadata (Version, Company, Description &c.)

Now this would _really_ useful if the same appeared when selecting a binary file in the changes panel. The two sides of the diff viewer would display the page described above, allowing you to see what metadata changed between versions.

data.title: workspace.getConfiguration('css') returns empty settings
data.body:
In an extension, call
`workspace.getConfiguration('css')`

Note that the result is empty.

Bug is in `model.js: getConfigurationKeys`. The code must not only iterate the properties of each configuration object, but also look at 'allOf'
(See how it is done in `processDefaultValues`)

data.title: Untitled files restored from backup issues
data.body:
To restore an untitled file from a backup we currently just do this:

`this.textFileService.resolveTextContent(this.restoreResource)`

That however will take the configured workspace encoding (which can easily be UTF-16) and thus might cause a corrupt content to return. 

I suggest to use the same options as for restoring files.

data.title: Check and clean up backup workspaces that don't have any files backed up on launch
data.body:
Since the storage for backup workspaces is independent from the actual backups inside that workspace, I think we need to be smarter about when to open a window for backups to restore. 

Today upon first startup we basically open a window for each of:

`const workspacesWithBackups = this.backupService.getWorkspaceBackupPaths();`

We only check if the backup workspace still exists but I think we also should check if it has backups or not. If not, it should be deleted.

I think this will be a more resilient experience in cases of random crashes where a backup workspace might get ouf of sync with its backups.

data.title: Investigate to restore untitled dirty files via editor input factories
data.body:
When hot exit is enabled, we rely on the fact that the UI state in a workspace restores all the files that were dirty in the previous session. 

However, for untitled files we do complicated measures to send the untitled files to restore to the window. Instead we should try to add untitled editors to the same UI persistence story that files already have.

I think this would clean up quite a bit of code and help out to restore untitled dirty files properly.

/cc @Tyriar

data.title: Tasks batch space in directory problem | Not encoding bug | bat doesn't work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1 (seems all versions)
- OS Version: Windows 7

It's not problem of encoding, it's doesn't matter in bat echo 1 or echo 123 or something else - bat file doesn't work at all
Issue was closed with wrong reason
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15444

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create directory with space: C:/project test
2. Create start.bat in this dir with text: echo 1
3. Create empty text.txt in this dir
4. Run VSCode & Open this dir as workspace
5. Ctrl+Shift+P -> Tasks -> Configure Task Runner -> Others
6. Import this configuration & save
{
	"version": "0.1.0",
	"command": "${workspaceRoot}/start.bat",
	"args": ["${file}"]
}
7. Open text.txt and compile Ctrl+Shift+B
8. Result
"c:\project" �� ����� ����७��� ��� ���譥�
��������, �ᯮ��塞�� �ணࠬ��� ��� �������� 䠩���.

data.title: Right click 'Find in workspace'
data.body:
As a user I'd like to be able to select a word, right-click on it, choose 'Find in workspace' and have VSCode put the word in the 'Find in files' text field and immediately perform the search for it.

This would work like in Xcode.

Currently, I have to select the word (mouse task), then cmd+shift+F (keyboard task), then enter. That's not optimal for repetitive use.

data.title: Code Action Light Bulb Only Shows up when Cursor Is On First Character of an Error
Wrong Comment Syntax for TSX/JSX
data.body:
From @daslicht on Microsoft/TypeScript-TmLanguage#355
When we open a ```*.tsx``` file,  VS Code shows TypeScript React in the bottom right corner.

If we now  highlight some text and call the comment shortcut, the block should be wrapped into the following:
```
	{/* ... */}
```

Currently there are just ```//``` inserted, which is wrong

data.title: Improvement for Tree Explorer API
data.body:
Umbrella issue for Tree Explorer API. Continuation of #12163

#14048 is a MVP that provides just enough functionalities for implementing a DB explorer. We decided to start minimal and evolve the API accordingly to feedback.

Here is a list of functionalities / questions that we should think about for future iterations.

### Functionalities

- Extension-initiated refresh (call `resolveChildren` again on a particular item)
- Extension-initiated update to tree items (`label`, etc)
- Icon (svg or png? should we allow remote icons? how this go with theming?)
- Badge on Activity Bar
- Reveal / Focus a tree item
- Customized right click / context-menu

### Questions

- `contributes.explorer` currently only allows one explorer per extension. Should we allow multiple explorers per extension? Or should we allow more complex Viewlet contributions, such as multi-section Viewlets?
- Should there be an user-defined, workspace config for which explorers to enable? (Would also solve the problem of ordering. Currently custom Viewlets are ordered by enabling sequences, and it's not easy to rearrange them if you have many Viewlets)
- Should we add activation event for Viewlets, like a `onLanguage:python` Viewlet that only shows its icon if the language is Python?

---

Edit:

### Functionalities

- Contributable top bar (we only have refresh by default)
  
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/20405375/991e6c70-acbd-11e6-9f85-ac20261c009c.png)

data.title: Build electron during npm install to solve issues with Cent OS

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 7.1.0
- OS Version: CentOS 6.7

vscode install uses pre-built electron; should be built natively, otherwise you're stuck with un-resolvable GLIBC version dependencies on some OSs. OR provide instructions to build code-oss natively.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. `./scripts/npm.sh install --unsafe-perm --arch=x64`
2. `./scripts/code.sh`
...
`[root@neawanna-cent6 vscode]# scripts/code.sh`
.build/electron/code-oss: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version GLIBCXX_3.4.14 not found (required by .build/electron/code-oss)
.build/electron/code-oss: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version CXXABI_1.3.5 not found (required by .build/electron/code-oss)
.build/electron/code-oss: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version GLIBCXX_3.4.15 not found (required by .build/electron/code-oss)
.build/electron/code-oss: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version GLIBCXX_3.4.15 not found (required by /apps/vscode/.build/electron/libnode.so)
```

data.title: Update error telemetry website to add links to source code from deminified call stack
data.body:
Currently, you can get the deminified call stack in the error telemetry website.
When you create a bug from there, the repro steps has links to the source code.
Without creating the bug, there is no direct way to open the source code from the error telemetry website making triaging just a little bit more harder
